visage 0.0.0.9008
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • visage OOP system

Load functions from the visage into target environment or search path

Source: R/oop.R
import_visage.Rd

This function is critical when other packages want to use the visage OOP system. Since this OOP system is based on environment, any instance will only run on the environment they defined. So, function like use_method which only exists in the package environment can not be accessed by the instance, unless the function has been loaded into the current environment by calling use_method <- visage::use_method, or require(visage) or library(visage). This issue can usually be addressed by using the package name directly inside the method body like this_method <- function() visage::use_method(). However, if it is not possible, then this function helps loads corresponding function into target environment or search path.

import_visage(
  env = parent.frame(),
  package = FALSE,
  reload = FALSE,
  import_oop = TRUE,
  import_base = TRUE,
  import_rand_var = FALSE,
  import_closed_form = FALSE,
  import_vi_model = FALSE
)

Arguments

env

Environment. The target environment.

package

Boolean. Whether or not it is used in a package.

reload

Boolean. Whether or not to reload the namespace. Only works if package = FALSE.

import_oop

Boolean. Whether or not to import OOP tools.

import_base

Boolean. Whether or not to import BASE class.

import_rand_var

Boolean. Whether or not to import RAND_VAR classes.

import_closed_form

Boolean. Whether or not to import CLOSED_FORM class.

import_vi_model

Boolean. Whether or not to import VI_MODEL classes.

Value

No return value, called for side effects.

Details

If it is used in a package, specify package = TRUE, this function will call define_pkg_fn. Otherwise, it will call require to attach the functions into the search path.
